items: Place two sturdy chairs parallel to each other, with the seats facing outward.
Stand between the chairs and place your hands on the seats, with your fingers facing forward.
Step your feet forward so that your body is at a slight angle, with your arms straight.
Bend your elbows and lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your back straight.
Push through your hands to straighten your arms and lift your body back up to the starting position.
Repeat for desired number of reps.
Targets triceps, chest, and shoulders
Can be done at home with minimal equipment
Improves upper body strength and endurance
Can be modified to increase or decrease difficulty
Helps with pushing movements in other exercises
Triceps
Chest
Shoulders
Core
Weighted dips
Assisted dips (using a resistance band or machine)
Tricep dips (with hands close together on the chair)
Single-leg dips (lifting one leg off the ground)
Decline dips (feet elevated on another chair or bench)
